review_title: An amazing organization with an amazing mission
job_title: Director, Quality Management in Las Vegas, NV
pros:
I truly can't say enough good things about Nevada Donor Network.
- Many organizations have a mission statement and have identified core values, this was my first experience working for an organization who LIVES their core values. The culture truly was FUN...the work was hard but I enjoyed going to work everyday.  I felt the organization cared about me as a person, not just the skills I brought to the organization.
- Staff are well compensated - very competitive pay, AMAZING benefits for employee and family, great education benefits.
- The organization has worked diligently and invested heavily in the development of its leaders. There is great trust and camaraderie among the management team.
- Management takes seriously concerns brought forward by staff and strives to establish accountability throughout the organization.
- The organization is not satisfied with being average - they are striving to be the best OPO in the universe and are making great progress!

It was truly a privilege to have worked for this organization.
cons: - Organ and tissue donation is a 24/7/365 industry.  However, despite the work being emotional taxing and ongoing, the Executive Management strives to create work/life balance.

High turnover of talent at all levels of the organization because smart, talented people are recruited but after hire are not allowed autonomy to do what they do best.

review_title: A few of the many reasons I love NDN
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Nevada Donor Network (NDN) is a unique organization that strives to make advancements in organ donation while maintaining a healthy work culture.  Employees are encouraged to be innovative and make NDN a better place.  Employee benefits are excellent and continue to evolve for what employees' need.  Benefits range from great dental and health insurance to frequent social events.  Hard work is encouraged and rewarded.   Regardless of which department you work in there are many opportunities to learn about other areas of donation and contribute to events.  It's an organization were one is given the opportunity to make a difference.
cons: I struggle to find any cons that are singularly connected to NDN.  If I have an issue or see something that seems problematic, I feel comfortable talking to my supervisor or anyone within management.  Some problems can't be fixed overnight but I feel this is an organization that seeks to innovate and improve without neglecting the work culture.

review_title: Nevada Donor Network- What a joke
job_title: Procurement Technician in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Knowing that you are saving lives is so self rewarding. I would not even had too be paid to work there. A job with so much responsibility and no room for error is awsome. Job advancement is certainly open to employees that make no mistakes and work very hard but only to a degree.

Just before we lost everything another Donor center merged with us and saved our jobs inspite of the incompetence of the Director and management. At that point management started laying off all the highly competent Technicians. One technician was let go after refusing to do a case which he felt was not an acceptable one to do. The Director pushed for income over well being of the people we were supposed to be helping. Within a year I recieved a few promotions and several raises but was abruptly let go for not returning a page which is entirely not true. I was told by one manager that they were paying me too much since my wife and I purchased a home and two new vehicles that year. Another manager would make comments about calling racial discrimination if she were ever fired. The technicians are of very high quality but management is worthless. God help the people who depend on them.
